rules.6x6: Place a digit from 1 to 6 into each empty cell in the grid so that each digit appears exactly once in each row, column and 2x3 outlined box. Each number and mathematical operation at the intersection of cells indicates that the number is the result of applying the mathematical operation to each pair of diagonally opposite cells of the intersection. Each 'O' at the intersection of cells indicates that the digits in those cells are odd. Each 'E' at the intersection of cells indicates that the digits in those cells are even. Some numbers may be replaced with '?'.
rules.9x9: Place a digit from 1 to 9 into each empty cell in the grid so that each digit appears exactly once in each row, column and 3x3 outlined box. Each number and mathematical operation at the intersection of cells indicates that the number is the result of applying the mathematical operation to each pair of diagonally opposite cells of the intersection. Each 'O' at the intersection of cells indicates that the digits in those cells are odd. Each 'E' at the intersection of cells indicates that the digits in those cells are even. Some numbers may be replaced with '?'.
